C ^ " V E S * D • When a man thinks himself secure in his Hestdenoe,
rehtng", in the~absence of the binding clauses of the Law, on the principles of fair ami honorable
dealing; and he finds himself suddenly and without cause ejected, it is usual to advertize his
new Address, that his Patrons may knew where tofind him.-—M. H E N R Y has therefore the
honor of announcing to his Friends and the Public, that he has removed from the Adelphi
to the N E W T H E A T R E ROYAL, HAY-MARKET, where he trusts to receive a continuance of that generous Encouragement and Liberality he has hitherto experienced.—It is to
M. H E N R Y , matter of great congratulation, that in changing his Scene of Action, he is
enabled to afford his Friends and the Public additional Accommodation and Entertainment;
the superior Resources of the Hay-Market Tlieatre, allowing him most materially to extend
his Sphere of Operation, and make those arrangements for the comfort of such as may honor
him with their presence, which the confined limits of the Adetphi, have hitherto prevented his
accomplishing.
